revision.comment: /* Number of Italian forces involved */ Comment
revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{MILHIST|class=B|b1=y|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y|WWII=y|British=y|French=y|ANZSP=y|Italian=y}} ==Untitled== This article should include years as well as month and day dates. Dave Dufour — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Davedufour|Davedufour]] ([[User talk:Davedufour|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Davedufour|contribs]]) 15:42, 29 December 2012 (UTC) == CE == Made some additions and altered citations to sfn, hope no-one minds.[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 08:25, 25 March 2015 (UTC) == Number of Italian forces involved == According to the infobox, the Italian forces in this battle numbered "150,000 soldiers, 1,600 guns, 600 tanks (mostly tankettes), 331 aircraft", but this is the same figure that shows in the [[Operation Compass]] page infobox: those were the overall Italian forces involved in Operation Compass, and I highly doubt that all of them were involved in the battle of Sidi Barrani. According to Enzo Biagi, "''La Caporetto della Marmarica''" (booklet n. 3 "''Le decisioni irrevocabili''" of the series "''La seconda guerra mondiale''"), the Italian forces in the area of Sidi Barrani numbered about 40,000, distributed as follows: the Libyan Corps (general Gallina) over a 35-km front spanning between Maktila and Nibeiwa; the [[4th Blackshirt Division (3 January)|4th Blackshirt Division "3 gennaio"]] (general Merzari), as a reserve, occupying Sidi Barrani (at a distance of about 20 kms from the Libyan Corps); on the second line, in Sofafi (30 kms west of Nibeiwa), the 63rd Infantry Division "Cirene" (general Spatocco) of the XXI Corps (general Dalmazzo).--[[User:Olonia|Olonia]] ([[User talk:Olonia|talk]]) 17:14, 8 December 2015 (UTC) Update: according to [https://books.google.it/books?id=vrVJAToL35QC&pg=PA9&lpg=PA9&dq=operation+compass+60,000&source=bl&ots=UEU_dbT37i&sig=7a90TmFdY0ac-GG5obJUj69wbOM&hl=it&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjJ7cih29fJAhUCxRQKHagfBd4Q6AEINTAD#v=onepage&q=operation%20compass%2060%2C000&f=false this other source], the Italians involved numbered 60,000. Also [https://books.google.it/books?id=uX7K1d49T84C&pg=PA77&lpg=PA77&dq=operation+compass+60,000&source=bl&ots=Vg60ccoyRV&sig=JzCHO7NmzrjB2i8_EYYf7IpbZFs&hl=it&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjJ7cih29fJAhUCxRQKHagfBd4Q6AEIOjAE#v=onepage&q=operation%20compass%2060%2C000&f=false this].--[[User:Olonia|Olonia]] ([[User talk:Olonia|talk]]) 01:49, 13 December 2015 (UTC) :Thanks for the amendments but can you add page numbers?[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 08:23, 13 December 2015 (UTC) ::How does it look now?[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 09:11, 13 December 2015 (UTC) :::[https://www.awm.gov.au/collection/RCDIG1070228/ Chapter 6 – Victory at Sidi Barrani] see here for map.[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 09:20, 13 December 2015 (UTC) ::::Page numbers are (Biagi) 167-168. Shouldn't Italian guns and tanks still be mentioned, somehow, in the Infobox? Maybe "part of 1,600 guns" and "part of 600 tanks and tankettes", like in [[Battle of Beda Fomm]] the Allied casualties are reported as "part of 1,928 9 December 1940 – 9 February 1941".--[[User:Olonia|Olonia]] ([[User talk:Olonia|talk]]) 09:29, 13 December 2015 (UTC) :::Thanks, I'm not sure how informative 'part of...' is since it's really saying 'not...' but if that's all we can find it might have to do. What would really help is an Italian-speaker with the Italian official history. I've had a delve into Long who is more informative than I expected but the sources and the article don't really treat Sidi Barrani the place as different from the area of operations. I'll keep looking. [[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 10:15, 13 December 2015 (UTC) ::::I know, the problem is that one might get the wrong impression, from the Infobox, that there were no tanks and guns on the Italian side.--[[User:Olonia|Olonia]] ([[User talk:Olonia|talk]]) 12:34, 13 December 2015 (UTC) :::Everything in the infobox ought to be in the main text and cited so we can't rely on guessing. [[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 14:34, 13 December 2015 (UTC) ::Found a source for the battle but inside Sidi Barrani there seems to have been the 4th Blackshirt Division plus one of the Libyan divisions plus lots of stragglers.[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 16:25, 13 December 2015 (UTC)
